description: Returns the membership details for specified member accounts for a behavior graph.

parameters.name: GraphArn
parameters.description: The ARN of the behavior graph for which to request the member details.

parameters.name: AccountIds
parameters.description: The list of Amazon Web Services account identifiers for the member account for which to return member details. You can request details for up to 50 member accounts at a time. You cannot use GetMembers to retrieve information about member accounts that were removed from the behavior graph. (string) ---

nested_items.name: MemberDetails
nested_items.description: The member account details that Detective is returning in response to the request.

nested_items.name: AccountId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account identifier for the member account.

nested_items.name: EmailAddress
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account root user email address for the member account.

nested_items.name: GraphArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the behavior graph.

nested_items.name: MasterId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account identifier of the administrator account for the behavior graph.

nested_items.name: AdministratorId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account identifier of the administrator account for the behavior graph.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current membership status of the member account. The status can have one of the following values:
INVITED - For invited accounts only. Indicates that the member was sent an invitation but has not yet responded.

VERIFICATION_IN_PROGRESS - For invited accounts only, indicates that Detective is verifying that the account identifier and email address provided for the member account match. If they do match, then Detective sends the invitation. If the email address and account identifier don't match, then the member cannot be added to the behavior graph. For organization accounts in the organization behavior graph, indicates that Detective is verifying that the account belongs to the organization.
VERIFICATION_FAILED - For invited accounts only. Indicates that the account and email address provided for the member account do not match, and Detective did not send an invitation to the account.

ENABLED - Indicates that the member account currently contributes data to the behavior graph. For invited accounts, the member account accepted the invitation. For organization accounts in the organization behavior graph, the Detective administrator account enabled the organization account as a member account.

ACCEPTED_BUT_DISABLED - The account accepted the invitation, or was enabled by the Detective administrator account, but is prevented from contributing data to the behavior graph. DisabledReason provides the reason why the member account is not enabled.

nested_items.name: DisabledReason
nested_items.description: For member accounts with a status of ACCEPTED_BUT_DISABLED, the reason that the member account is not enabled.
VOLUME_TOO_HIGH - Indicates that adding the member account would cause the data volume for the behavior graph to be too high.
VOLUME_UNKNOWN - Indicates that Detective is unable to verify the data volume for the member account. This is usually because the member account is not enrolled in Amazon GuardDuty.

nested_items.name: InvitedTime
nested_items.description: For invited accounts, the date and time that Detective sent the invitation to the account. The value is an ISO8601 formatted string. For example, 2021-08-18T16:35:56.284Z.

nested_items.name: UpdatedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the member account was last updated. The value is an ISO8601 formatted string. For example, 2021-08-18T16:35:56.284Z.

nested_items.name: VolumeUsageInBytes
nested_items.description: The data volume in bytes per day for the member account.

nested_items.name: VolumeUsageUpdatedTime
nested_items.description: The data and time when the member account data volume was last updated. The value is an ISO8601 formatted string. For example, 2021-08-18T16:35:56.284Z.

nested_items.name: PercentOfGraphUtilization
nested_items.description: The member account data volume as a percentage of the maximum allowed data volume. 0 indicates 0 percent, and 100 indicates 100 percent.

nested_items.name: PercentOfGraphUtilizationUpdatedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the graph utilization percentage was last updated. The value is an ISO8601 formatted string. For example, 2021-08-18T16:35:56.284Z.

nested_items.name: InvitationType
nested_items.description: The type of behavior graph membership.

nested_items.name: VolumeUsageByDatasourcePackage
nested_items.description: Details on the volume of usage for each data source package in a behavior graph.

nested_items.name: VolumeUsageInBytes
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: VolumeUsageInBytes
nested_items.description: Total volume of data in bytes per day ingested for a given data source package.

nested_items.name: VolumeUsageUpdateTime
nested_items.description: The data and time when the member account data volume was last updated. The value is an ISO8601 formatted string. For example, 2021-08-18T16:35:56.284Z.

nested_items.name: DatasourcePackageIngestStates
nested_items.description: The state of a data source package for the behavior graph.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: UnprocessedAccounts
nested_items.description: The requested member accounts for which Detective was unable to return member details.

nested_items.name: AccountId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account identifier of the member account that was not processed.

nested_items.name: Reason
nested_items.description: The reason that the member account request could not be processed.
